definition: to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
store credit (credit to be spent at a specified retailer)

sentences.english: Buying coupons can be extremely addictive, because sometimes the deals are just too tempting.
sentences.chinese: 买抵用券会上瘾，因为有时候商品太诱惑人了。

sentences.english: Frequently used in international trade to make funds available in a foreign location.
sentences.chinese: 常用于国际贸易中，以使资金可在国外某地抵用。

sentences.english: Can be used to redeem future purchases of classes.
sentences.chinese: 可用于下次购买课程时直接抵用现金。

sentences.english: Arrived with your first order volume automatically deducted 10 dollars.
sentences.chinese: 抵用卷在您第一个订单中自动抵扣10美金。

definition: bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
store credit (credit to be spent at a specified retailer)
(Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
